verses.verse: Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies To the leader. A Psalm of David. (Ps 17.13; 18.48) Deliver me, O LORD, from evildoers; protect me from those who are violent,
(Ps 36.4; 56.6) who plan evil things in their minds and stir up wars continually.
(Ps 57.4; 58.4; Jas 3.8) They make their tongue sharp as a snake’s, and under their lips is the venom of vipers. Selah
(Ps 71.4) Guard me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; protect me from the violent who have planned my downfall.
(Ps 31.4; 35.7; 141.9) The arrogant have hidden a trap for me, and with cords they have spread a net, (Or they have spread cords as a net) along the road they have set snares for me. Selah
(Ps 16.2; 116.1; 143.1) I say to the LORD, “You are my God; give ear, O LORD, to the voice of my supplications.”
(Ps 28.8; 144.10) O LORD, my Lord, my strong deliverer, you have covered my head in the day of battle.
(Ps 10.2; 112.10) Do not grant, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; do not further their evil plot. (Heb adds they are exalted) Selah
(Ps 7.16) Those who surround me lift up their heads; (Cn: Heb those who surround me are uplifted in head) let the mischief of their lips overwhelm them!
(Ps 11.6; 21.9; 36.12) Let burning coals fall on them! Let them be flung into pits, no more to rise!
(Ps 34.21) Do not let the slanderer be established in the land; let evil speedily hunt down the violent!
(Ps 9.4; 35.10) I know that the LORD maintains the cause of the needy and executes justice for the poor.
(Ps 11.7; 97.12) Surely the righteous shall give thanks to your name; the upright shall live in your presence.
